thread.title: High school football rankings - Times Union
thread.title_full: High school football rankings - Times Union

author: James Allen
title: High school football rankings - Times Union
text:
CLASS AA
1. Shaker (6-0, Last week No. 1): The Blue Bison look to add more hardware to their Liberty Division title by defeating rival Colonie in the Colonie Town Cup game.
2. Saratoga (6-0, LW No. 2): Dakota Harvey scored on a five-yard touchdown pass from Brian Williams with 1:23 left as the Blue Streaks clinched the No. 1 seed from the Empire Division with a 25-24 win over Christian Brothers Academy .
3. Shenendehowa (3-3, LW No. 3): The Plainsmen pulled away in the second half to post a 50-20 decision over Albany.
4. Guilderland (5-1, LW No. 4): The Dutchmen can secure the program's first home playoff game since 2007 Friday with a win against Shenendehowa.
5. Columbia (4-2, Not rated): Dylan Dubuque ran for 257 yards and three touchdowns as the Blue Devils knocked off La Salle 28-7.
Team to watch: Bethlehem (3-3)
CLASS A
1. Troy (6-0, LW No. 1): The Flying Horses easily secured the No. 1 seed from the Southeast Division with a 60-6 verdict over Mohonasen.
2. Burnt Hills (6-0, LW No. 2): Mike Leveroni carried the ball 15 times for 164 yards and two touchdowns, plus added a 66-yard TD reception, as the Spartans defeated Gloversville 50-14 to win the North west Division title for the first time since 2012.
3. Queensbury (4-2, LW No. 3): Patrick Conway proved to be highly efficient against Scotia, carrying the ball five times for 44 yards and four touchdowns in a 34-14 victory.
4. Amsterdam (3-3, LW No. 4): Trey Holloway threw for two touchdowns and ran for one, helping the Rugged Rams lock up the No. 2 Southeast seed with a 35-14 win at Averill Park.
5. South Glens Falls (3-3, LW NR): The Bulldogs prevented Green Tech from scoring in the second half and held on for a 19-16 victory over the Eagles.
Team to watch: Green Tech (4-2)
CLASS B
1. Schuylerville (6-0, LW No. 1): The Black Horses amassed 488 yards on offense in recording a 33-0 victory over Glens Falls to win the West Division for the second straight year.
2. Schalmont (6-0, LW No. 2): Cameron Brooks rushed for 134 yards and three touchdowns as the Sabres sliced past Lansingburgh 40-15.
3. Ravena (5-0, LW No. 4): Matt Ferriero rolled up 176 yards rushing and three touchdowns in just over one half as the Indians beat Hudson 44-12.
4. Glens Falls (5-1, LW No. 3): The Indians look to bounce back from the loss to Schuylerville on Saturday against Hudson Falls in the Jug Game.
5. Lansingburgh (4-2, LW No. 5): The Knights, the No. 3 seed from the Reinfurt Division , take on West Division champion Schuylerville on Friday.
Team to watch: Hudson Falls (4-2)
CLASS C
1. Greenwich (6-0, LW No. 1): Lukas Whitehouse rushed for 200 yards and four touchdowns as the Witches posted a 51-12 win over Mechanicville.
2. Fonda (5-0, LW No. 2): The Braves needed 21 points in the fourth quarter to finally draw away in a 43-19 triumph against Schoharie/BKW.
3. Corinth (4-2, LW No. 3): The Tomahawks captured the No. 2 North Division seed with a 38-26 victory against Hoosick Falls.
4. Hoosic Valley (4-2, LW No. 4): The Indians inched closer to a wild-card playoff berth by registering a 33-6 win at Lake George/Hadley-Luzerne.
5. Mechanicville (4-2, LW No. 5): The Red Raiders, the Central Division champions, close out their division slate against Watervliet.
Teams to watch: Coxsackie-Athens (4-2), Hoosick Falls (4-2), Stillwater (4-2)
CLASS D
1. Cambridge (6-0, LW No. 1): The Indians won their second straight contest against Class C competition with a 41-6 victory at Chatham.
2. Whitehall (6-0, LW No. 2): Daryl Hillman turned the lights outs on Salem, rushing for 227 yards and four touchdowns in a 49-0 road victory.
3. Canajoharie (4-2, LW No. 4): Tangen Rush stopped Warrensburg quarterback Daniel Monthony on a two-point conversion attempt with 1:06 left as the Cougars edged the Burghers 13-12.
4. Warrensburg (2-4, LW No. 3): The Burghers conclude their Class D schedule Saturday against Salem.
5. Rensselaer (3-3, LW No. 5): The Rams face a must-win scenario Friday when they play host to Canajoharie.
